div.l: For he hadde swonken alle þe long nyght
And saide fare welle Malyn swete wight
The day is comen I may no lenger a bide
But eủer mo wher I go or ride
I am þyn owne clerke so haue I sele
Now dere lemman ꝙquod she go fare wele
But or þow go oo thyng I wil the telle
Whan þat þow wendest hamward by the Mille
Riȝt atte þe entre of þe dore by hynde
Þow shalt a cake of half a busshel fynde
Þat was I maked of þyn own mele
Whiche þat I help my Sir for to stele
And god lemman god þe saue and kepe
And with þat word Almost he con to wepe
Aleyn vp rist ⁊and þought or þat it dawe
I wil go crepen in by me felowe
And fond þe cradel with his hond a noon
Bi god thought he alle wrong I haue mysgon
Myn hed is toty of my swynk to nyȝt
That makith me þat I go nought a right
I wot wel by the cradel I haue mysgo
Here lithe þe Miller and his wif Also
And forth he goth on twenti deuel way
Vn to þe bedd þer þe Miller lay
And wend haue cropen by his felow Iohn
And by the Miller In he crepe a noon
And caught hym by the nek ⁊and soft he spake
He saide þᵘou Iohn þow swyneshed a wake
For cristes sawle and here a noble game
For by þat lord þat callid is seyn Iame
As I haue þries in þis short nyght
Swyued þe Myllers doughter bolt vp right
Whil þow hast as a coward ben a gast
Ȝe false harlot þᵈuod þe myller hast
A false treytour false clerke qduod he
Þow shalt be ded by goddys dignite
Who dorst be so bold to disparage
My doughter þat is comen of siche lynag͗e
And by the þrote bolle he caught Aleyn
